com.camerontec.catalys.server.ha.communications.io

Class HAMessagingSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.server.ha.communications.io.HAMessagingSystem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IChannelFactory

    public final class HAMessagingSystem
extends Object
implements IChannelFactory
    This class is the public entry point into the HA messaging system.

    It is expected that an application creates a single instance of this class, however, that is not enforced. An instance of this class must be started prior to use and stopped after use. In addition, on shutdown or when no longer required, it is recommended that the instance be destroyed to release all resources.

      • HAMessagingSystem

        @Deprecated
public HAMessagingSystem(ClusterNode localNode,
                                     Set<ClusterNode> remoteNodes,
                                     int configuredMaxMessageLength,
                                     boolean configuredTCPNoDelay,
                                     int configuredSoLinger,
                                     int configuredTCPSendBufferSize,
                                     int configuredTCPReceiveBufferSize,
                                     String configuredMulticastAddress,
                                     int configuredMulticastPort,
                                     String configuredDatagramProtocolFamily,
                                     int configuredMulticastTimeToLive,
                                     int configuredMaxDatagramSize,
                                     int configuredUDPSendBufferSize,
                                     int configuredUDPReceiveBufferSize,
                                     boolean configuredMinimizeContextSwitchLatency,
                                     int configuredOutboundDataMessageBufferSize,
                                     int configuredInboundDataMessageBufferSize)
        Deprecated. use HAMessagingSystem(ClusterNode, Set, int, boolean, boolean, int, int, int, String, int, String, int, int, int, int, boolean, int, int, HABufferFactory) instead.
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        localNode - The local cluster node. May not be null.
        remoteNodes - The remote cluster nodes. May not be null or empty.
        configuredMaxMessageLength - The maximum cluster message length. Must be at least MIN_MAX_MESSAGE_LENGTH (64 kB).
        configuredTCPNoDelay - True to disable Nagle's algorithm for TCP connections.
        configuredTCPSendBufferSize - Ignored unless > 0, otherwise specifies desired TCP socket send buffer size.
        configuredTCPReceiveBufferSize - Ignored unless > 0, otherwise specifies desired TCP socket receive buffer size.
        configuredMulticastAddress - The multicast replication address. May be null in which case multicast is disabled.
        configuredMulticastPort - The multicast replication port. May be < 0 in which case multicast is disabled.
        configuredDatagramProtocolFamily - The datagram protocol family. May be null in which case the default INET (IPv4) is used. Allowable values are INET and INET6. If explicitly configured then it must match the format of the specified multicastAddress.
        configuredMulticastTimeToLive - Multicast time to live. Actual meaning depends on the Protocol Family in use.
        configuredMaxDatagramSize - The maximum datagram packet size that will be multicast by this subsystem. Internally some additional space is reserved for overhead which further reduces the space remaining for user data.
        configuredUDPSendBufferSize - The UDP datagram socket send buffer size.
        configuredUDPReceiveBufferSize - The UDP datagram socket receive buffer size.
        configuredMinimizeContextSwitchLatency - Prefer minimal context switch latency over lower CPU load.
        configuredOutboundDataMessageBufferSize - Outbound write request buffer size.
        configuredInboundDataMessageBufferSize - Inbound write request buffer size.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If any parameter is invalid or the messaging system cannot be configured as requested.

      • HAMessagingSystem

        public HAMessagingSystem(ClusterNode localNode,
                         Set<ClusterNode> remoteNodes,
                         int configuredMaxMessageLength,
                         boolean configuredTCPNoDelay,
                         boolean configuredTCPKeepAlive,
                         int configuredSoLinger,
                         int configuredTCPSendBufferSize,
                         int configuredTCPReceiveBufferSize,
                         String configuredMulticastAddress,
                         int configuredMulticastPort,
                         String configuredDatagramProtocolFamily,
                         int configuredMulticastTimeToLive,
                         int configuredMaxDatagramSize,
                         int configuredUDPSendBufferSize,
                         int configuredUDPReceiveBufferSize,
                         boolean configuredMinimizeContextSwitchLatency,
                         int configuredOutboundDataMessageBufferSize,
                         int configuredInboundDataMessageBufferSize,
                         HABufferFactory bufferFactory)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        localNode - The local cluster node. May not be null.
        remoteNodes - The remote cluster nodes. May not be null or empty.
        configuredMaxMessageLength - The maximum cluster message length. Must be at least MIN_MAX_MESSAGE_LENGTH (64 kB).
        configuredTCPNoDelay - True to disable Nagle's algorithm for TCP connections.
        configuredTCPKeepAlive - True to enable the keep alive option for TCP connections.
        configuredTCPSendBufferSize - Ignored unless > 0, otherwise specifies desired TCP socket send buffer size.
        configuredTCPReceiveBufferSize - Ignored unless > 0, otherwise specifies desired TCP socket receive buffer size.
        configuredMulticastAddress - The multicast replication address. May be null in which case multicast is disabled.
        configuredMulticastPort - The multicast replication port. May be < 0 in which case multicast is disabled.
        configuredDatagramProtocolFamily - The datagram protocol family. May be null in which case the default INET (IPv4) is used. Allowable values are INET and INET6. If explicitly configured then it must match the format of the specified multicastAddress.
        configuredMulticastTimeToLive - Multicast time to live. Actual meaning depends on the Protocol Family in use.
        configuredMaxDatagramSize - The maximum datagram packet size that will be multicast by this subsystem. Internally some additional space is reserved for overhead which further reduces the space remaining for user data.
        configuredUDPSendBufferSize - The UDP datagram socket send buffer size.
        configuredUDPReceiveBufferSize - The UDP datagram socket receive buffer size.
        configuredMinimizeContextSwitchLatency - Prefer minimal context switch latency over lower CPU load.
        configuredOutboundDataMessageBufferSize - Outbound write request buffer size.
        configuredInboundDataMessageBufferSize - Inbound write request buffer size.
        bufferFactory - The buffer used to obtain serialization and deserialization buffers.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If any parameter is invalid or the messaging system cannot be configured as requested.

      • start

        public void start()
        Start the messaging system.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If the messaging system is already started or has been destroyed.
        See Also:
        stop(), destroy()

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop the messaging system.

        Note that this method does not release all memory related resources (which are off heap). Use destroy() to do that.

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If the messaging system is not currently running.
        See Also:
        start(), destroy()

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Permanently destroy the messaging system and release all remaining resources.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If the messaging system is currently started or is already destroyed.

      • getIndicativeConnectionEstablishmentMillis

        public long getIndicativeConnectionEstablishmentMillis()
        Return an indicative connection establishment time in milliseconds.

        Only a single thread is used to both initiate and accept conditions which can result in serialization of such actions (i.e. instead of them happening concurrently). In addition, connection establishment happens against every other cluster node which must be taken into account.

        Returns:
        An indicative number of milliseconds after which it might be possible to assume that all connections should have been established.
